answers.answer: It sounds like you may have a systemic illness like polymyositis or some connective tissue disease.  You most likely have had an echo and a test for coronary artery disease and you should make sure there are OK.  Likely you should seek a second opinion.

question: Prior to this episode an apparent healthy male smoker/beer drinker, 1 pack per day.Early Nov. 07 had 2 teeth removed, one was infected.  Five days later couldn't breathe and went to ER.  Diagnosed with atypical pneumonia and also diabetes.  Prescribed antibiotics for pneumonia and actos/metformin for diabetesDay after Christmas re-entered ER.  Gained 30 lbs, water retention, and still had trouble breathing.  Taking steroids relieved breathing problem.  Stopped actos.  Put on lasix and continued antibiotics.  Mid January 08, lungs are clear and cardiologist performs heart catherization.  Discovers "wedge pressure" of 25.  Treating for congestive heart failure.  Vitals according to Drs are normal.  BP 110/70, cholesterol scan normal, lung function normal.  Yet there is continuous joint/muscle pain, muscle weakness (can barely pick up 10 lbs) and breathing is very difficult.At wits end!  I know this a very brief synopsis.  Any suggestions?  Are the Drs. missing something?Thanks in advance for your time and consideration, Paulieg
title: PAH, CONGESTIVE HEART FAILURE-WHICH IS IT
